column4: Hmm ... not so happy now after all the backups, downloads and hunting around to make things work. Think I might have to revert to 10.04
Hold on. What is your present desktop environment?
To find out, use Disk Utility.
Thx - Disk seems fine ... It more that I'm finding a general slowness about 11.10 - I have an laptop with 1 Gig mem and an Intel Pentium M  1.6GHz. Is that not enough horse-power for 11.10
That could be the case. I have heard similar complaints. I myself am using a more powerful laptop and I do not have such slow response.
I'm using the default - so it must be unity

I agree. Before reverting back to 10.04 you could install the package gnome-shell and log out. Before you log in,you could select then "GNOME Classic (No effects" in the login menu. Try this and compare its performance with that of Ubuntu 10.04.
No. It is only similar to 10.10'sGNOME.
hmm thx  ..... let me take a look
What abot Unity 2D ... do u know anything about it?
I do not know much about it.
seems I'm already running Unity 2D - Found this link which shows u how to test: http://www.liberiangeek.net/2011/10/how-to-quickly-find-out-if-ubuntu-is-running-unity-3d/
So compare this performance with that of your previous Ubuntu 10.04 installation. It should not differ much in my opinion.
It's definitely slower :-( but I did find a way to install the old interface now (called ubuntu classic) http://www.liberiangeek.net/2011/08/return-to-ubuntu-classic-desktop-in-ubuntu-11-10/

I tested ubuntu-classic and liked it. If your Unity 2D is definitely slower then I would conclude that there is an implementation error. I told you that I do not know much about Unity. So I cannot suggest a remedy.
